author: Staff Reporter
text:
Stating that the City Municipal Corporation had failed to implement schemes for the benefit of the people in the past five years, Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam cadre staged a demonstration near the District Collectorate on Wednesday.

Organised by DMK’s Central District wing, its secretary R. Rajendran said that the Mettur – Salem Dedicated Water Supply Scheme brought by the DMK regime earlier was yet to be completed.

Mr. Rajendran said that corruption was prevailing at all levels in the Corporation. “The ruling AIADMK has even failed to complete the scheme that were brought by the DMK regime,” he added.

The cadre said that only proposals were made by the civic body and none of it was implemented. They also condemned the attack on DMK councillors during the council meetings. More than 800 cadre, including 100 women, participated in the demonstration.
title: DMK cadre stage protest
